item.title: Religious Beliefs
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

dain bramage:

It takes 8 minutes for light to reach earth from the sun. Remember, the speed of light is FUCKING FAST IN A VACUUM, and the sun is FUCKING CLOSE (compared to any other star).

Didn’t know that. Thank you for clarifying.

item.title: Religious Beliefs
item.dc:creator: @dain_bramage dain bramage
item.description:
@dain_bramage wrote:

[quote=“drubrkletern, post:101, topic:440679”][quote author=m1lkman link=topic=543355.msg3983410#msg3983410 date=1335569607]

To that time travel thing… I remember seeing a topic on MITB about seeing the past of places extremely far away because the light emitting from it is old or some shit, and you see the light that has come to us from billions of years ago (Or something?)
So a race millions of light years away looking at us through a telescope would see the 1500s or something
Not saying its real or something but was pretty interesting so I thought I’d say it here.

A race 1 light year away looking at us would see us in 2011. So 500 light years away they would see the 1500s.
Light from the sun is like 7 years old before it hits us. (recalling from memory)

I’m interested in the law that states time travel is possible. I know time travel into the future is possible but I have heard nothing about the past.
[/quote]
Yeah it was something along those lines[/quote]
It takes 8 minutes for light to reach earth from the sun. Remember, the speed of light is FUCKING FAST IN A VACUUM, and the sun is FUCKING CLOSE (compared to any other star).

Read full topic

item.title: Religious Beliefs
item.dc:creator: @Wet_Dreamss Wet Dreamss
item.description:
@Wet_Dreamss wrote:

[quote=“m1lkman, post:96, topic:440679”][quote author=Bowser jr link=topic=543355.msg3983114#msg3983114 date=1335535004]

no GOD did it Science just proves he exists

I just cannot grasp the thought of a god, I do not understand why people believe that somone or something is controlling everyone and everything. Science does not prove god exists, in my opinion, because science is theories and laws that are all proved to be true.

Lol Theories can never be proven to be true. A theory explains something. A law states something. They are very different. Creation Theory can not be proved correct because it is impossible to travel back in time to witness it. The same applies with the Primordial soup theory.

Creation “Theory” cannot be proven, because all the evidence go against it, and lot of major fields of science renders it impossible.
The soup theory can be proven by reproduce parts of it and show us that its mechanics would lead to life.

Could you please get some common sense.
[/quote]

Has anyone created an amino acid from inorganic elements?[/quote]
muahaha, nice.

Although, your previous post said that it was impossible to travel back into time, which is false.
The laws of Physics says that Time Travel is 100% possible.

Which is where aliens come into play. I think that aliens are humans in the future because no thing can look so similar to humans (head, eyes, mouth positioning) and they travel back into the past to abduct humans that play an important role in the future.

Mind fuck?
???
Profit???

Read full topic

item.title: Religious Beliefs
item.dc:creator: @dain_bramage dain bramage
item.description:
@dain_bramage wrote:

I find it silly how people go nuts thinking that religion “starts wars”. Generally speaking, wars are started for people to obtain land off others, as it will give the leaders more personal power due to the income generated from having good land. Religion doesn’t necessarily prolong wars either, mainly due to the fact that modern laws and morals have been developed from religion (such as the moral that murder is wrong) and are used in protest to end wars early (modern). Religion is more-so used to encourage people to fight [and / or] take sides, often making one side larger than the other (if one is claiming to be fighting for a larger user-base religion), often ending wars quicker (not modern) (but this feature can actually make wars bigger and last longer if the religion used is the same-size).

– My response to a person saying that “religion is bad because it starts all of the wars”. I personally am not religious (I was raised to be “free to chose my religion” by my [atheist] parents, and after exploring Christianity for a year or so, I moved straight to atheism. PS: This post really has no meaning, but it’s a nice read (I guess).

Read full topic
